segments.transcription: Hold on ([P 1] nn), Alice, to live in a lonely castle so far from the ([MSR 1] from the ci-) from the city. Tonight, it was even harder because the storm frightened her. It's not a good night for ghosts ([MSR 0] she) she thought.

She put some more firewood in([P 0] n) to the fire. She knew it was saying she was only going; she was only fooling herself. She knew the ghost ([MSR 1] would be) would be in the chapel again {g: tonight}.

([MSR 0] She) She had seen every night since she had moved in([P 0] n)to the castle. ([MSR 1] She) She went to the large window and slowly moved the curtain apart. She could see the chapel down the hill ([MSR 0] of) of.
A flash of lightning lit the sky for a moment. She looked out again. This time, she saw the glow coming from the chapel her ghost was waiting.
